popt4jlib

Class DblArray1SparseVectorMT

  • java.lang.Object
    • popt4jlib.DblArray1SparseVector
      • popt4jlib.DblArray1SparseVectorMT
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, SparseVectorIntf, VectorIntf

    public class DblArray1SparseVectorMT
extends DblArray1SparseVector
    sparse double[] implementation of VectorIntf, maintaining two arrays, an index array, and a values array. Useful when dealing with very high-dimensional vectors that are sparse to a significant degree (e.g. in Information Retrieval, one may create vectors in 50.000 dimensions, but each vector may have only a few tens or hundreds of non-zero components). Notice that getCoord/setCoord operations can be much more costly than the same operations when operating with a DblArray1Vector (where the operations are O(1) -constant time simple memory accesses). Notice also that the class is thread-safe but quite expensive. A faster but not thread-safe implementation is DblArray1SparseVector. Also notice that this class does not support default-values other than zero for components.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2015

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getCoord

        public double getCoord(int i)
                throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        return the i-th coordinate of this VectorIntf (i must be in the set {0,1,2,...getNumCoords()-1}). Has O(log(_ilen)) worst-case time-complexity where _ilen is the (max.) number of non-zeros in this vector.
        Specified by:
        getCoord in interface VectorIntf
        Overrides:
        getCoord in class DblArray1SparseVector
        Parameters:
        i - int
        Returns:
        double
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if i is not in the set mentioned above

      • setCoord

        public void setCoord(int i,
                     double val)
              throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException,
                     ParallelException
        set the i-th coordinate of this VectorIntf (i must be in the set {0,1,2,...getNumCoords()-1}). Repeated calls to this method for indices not in the original contruction of this vector will eventually destroy its sparsity. Has O(_ilen/NT) worst-case time-complexity where _ilen is the (max.) number of non-zeros in the array and NT is the number of cores in the system. The time-complexity reduces to O(log(_ilen)) if the element to be set, is already non-zero before the operation.
        Specified by:
        setCoord in interface VectorIntf
        Overrides:
        setCoord in class DblArray1SparseVector
        Parameters:
        i - int
        val - double
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if i is not in the set mentioned above
        ParallelException - if a read-lock for this object is already acquired by the current thread and some-other thread as well.

      • getIthNonZeroPos

        public int getIthNonZeroPos(int i)
                     throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        the purpose of this routine is to allow a traversal of the non-zeros of this object as follows: 
         
 sparsevector.getReadLock();
 for (int i=0; i<sparsevector.getNumNonZeros(); i++) {
   int    pos = sparsevector.getIthNonZeroPos(i);
   double val = sparsevector.getCoord(pos);
   // do whatever must be done...
 }
 sparsevector.releaseReadLock();
        It is possible that one or more of the positions returned contain zero values (but in the past they must have had non-zero value). But no position with a current non-zero value will be missed.
        Specified by:
        getIthNonZeroPos in interface SparseVectorIntf
        Overrides:
        getIthNonZeroPos in class DblArray1SparseVector
        Parameters:
        i - int
        Returns:
        int
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if i is out-of-bounds. Always throws if this is the zero vector.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object other)
        return true iff the other vector is exactly equal to this, component-wise. When invoked with another DblArray1SparseVectorMT argument, the read-locks of both objects (this, and the argument) will be requested, and released in the same order they were requested. Notice that the class inherits the hashCode() implementation from its super-class.
        Overrides:
        equals in class DblArray1SparseVector
        Parameters:
        other - Object
        Returns:
        boolean
